lines.text: [last lines]
Who's next?
[looks at camera]
Perhaps... you?

[Hearing his dog bark in the room beside him]
Well, at least feed my dog, please!

[Somber tone]
He'll be fed alright.

[reading Arthur Grimsdyke's revenge letter written in the dead James Elliot's blood]
"You were cruel and mean right from the start, now you can truly say you have no... heart".

[Revived to life, twitching and screaming in pain]
Oh, Enid!

[Yelling towards the front door]
Charles!
Help me!

[walks in]
What's happened?
[to Enid]
What have you done?
I wished him alive again... forever!
Don't you realize he's been embalmed? His veins are filled with embalming fluid, burning into him!

[Sobbing]
Oh, no!

[Screaming]
Enid, do something! For God's sake, Enid, help me!

[Enid grabs a sword from the wall]
No, no! Enid, don't!
The men have asked me to come and talk to you.
Yes?
It's about the heating. It's been very cold these past few nights. We wondered if...

[cutting him off]
For reasons of economy, the heating is turned off at 2000 hours. You should all be in bed by then. After all, there's no point in staying up. You can't see anything.
The beds are cold. There aren't enough blankets!
I am trying to run this place as efficiently and economically as I can. I am afraid the current budget does not include the cost of new blankets.
Do you know anything about blind people?
No, I can't say I do 'til I took over this job, but I was in the army over 20 years and I learned to handle all kinds of men there.

With all due respect sir, we are not soldiers. Blind people are not like people with sight. We have lost one sense, but the loss of that sense only tends to sharpen the others. Do you know what that means? We feel things more acutely. If food tastes bad, it tastes worse to us. If a room is dirty, we feel every speck. If an insect scurries across the floor, we hear it. And if it's cold, we feel the cold more. Why don't you sell that expensive painting on your wall and buy us fuel or extra blankets?
I was not aware that the administration of expenditure for this establishment had been handed to you, Mister Carter! Good morning!
